alert.note: Alert for Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 25 at 4:29AM CST until further notice by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Harpeth River Below Franklin affecting Williamson County. For the Harpeth River...including Franklin...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Harpeth River Below Franklin. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Flooding of properties adjacent to the river begins near Hillsboro Road and Mack Hatcher Memorial Parkway. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 25.1 feet and cresting. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM CST.
